sentences.en: "We'll see what other prisoner officers think, all right?"
sentences.cn: “我们要了解一下其他监狱官的想法，好吗？”

sentences.en: He was being held prisoner.
sentences.cn: 他正遭囚禁。

sentences.en: He was held prisoner in Vietnam from 1966 to 1973.
sentences.cn: 他在1966年到1973年间被作为战俘关押在越南。

sentences.en: He was taken prisoner in North Africa in 1942.
sentences.cn: 他于1942年在北非被俘。

sentences.en: His men made a sortie to Guazatan and took a prisoner.
sentences.cn: 他的士兵袭击了瓜扎坦，擒获了一名俘虏。

sentences.en: Nominally she is the king's prisoner.
sentences.cn: 名义上她是国王的囚犯。

sentences.en: Officers mistook Stephen for an escaped prisoner.
sentences.cn: 警官误以为斯蒂芬是一名逃犯。

sentences.en: One prisoner claimed he'd been dragged to a cell, stripped and beaten.
sentences.cn: 一名犯人声称他曾被拖进一间牢房，全身被脱光并遭到毒打。

sentences.en: One prisoner was still holding out on the roof of the jail.
sentences.cn: 一名犯人仍在监狱的房顶上顽抗。

sentences.en: Our pilot was taken prisoner .
sentences.cn: 我们的飞行员被抓起来了。

sentences.en: Prisoners here only serve short sentences.
sentences.cn: 这里的犯人只是短期服刑。

sentences.en: Relationships between the staff and the prisoners are good.
sentences.cn: 狱警和犯人相处良好。

sentences.en: She was a prisoner of her own ego.
sentences.cn: 她为自己的自尊心所困。

sentences.en: The army advanced, taking 200,000 prisoners .
sentences.cn: 军队向前推进，抓获20万名俘虏。

sentences.en: The escaped prisoner was nowhere in sight.
sentences.cn: 越狱的囚犯已经无影无踪了。

sentences.en: The organization is arguing for the release of political prisoners (= people in prison because of their political opinions ) .
sentences.cn: 该组织正在争取释放政治犯。

sentences.en: The prisoner had to be restrained by the police.
sentences.cn: 警察只好强行制住囚犯。

sentences.en: The prisoner started to wash down the walls of his cell.
sentences.cn: 囚犯开始冲洗各自囚室的墙壁。

sentences.en: The prisoner was put on probation .
sentences.cn: 犯人已获缓刑。

sentences.en: The prisoner was taken under escort to the jail.
sentences.cn: 罪犯被押送到监狱.

sentences.en: the prisoner's repeated denials of the charges against him
sentences.cn: 囚犯再三否认对他的指控

phrases.tran_cn: （追求目标时）富于进取的，毫不妥协的

trans.tran_en: someone who is kept in a prison as a legal punishment for a crime or while they are waiting for their  trial
